greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,m) = binomial(m!,n).
comment: T(n,m) = number of n X m arrays with each row a permutation of 1..m and rows lexicographically in strictly increasing order.
link: R. H. Hardin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
mathematica: t[n_, m_] := Binomial[m!, n]; Table[t[m - n + 1, n], {m, 9}, {n, m, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* to display table in Comment *) Table[ t[m, n], {m, 10}, {n, 8}] // TableForm (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 02 2010 *)
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, Sep 01 2010
